page.title: 09Home life in Alresford
page.content: During weekends and holiday periods, homelife in Alresford often revolves around various hobbies and small tasks in the home. The people usually work on their cars over the weekends, and much of their spare time is also taken up gardening. One particular hobby that has become a part of the homelife, is that of D.I.Y. and home improvements. Other weekend activities include sailing at Alresford Creek, a sport in which the whole family can participate and fishing at the site of the old sand and gravel pits which have now been made into ponds. Pleasant country walks and nature study hobbies also take up a lot of the people's free time, as do the various clubs and societies that are run in Alresford. About 10% of the population attend the local church, St. Andrews.
